Element: 1. What Aerius is and what it is used for
Text: 1.       What Aerius is and what it is used for

Element: What Aerius is
Text: What Aerius is

Element: Aerius contains desloratadine which is an antihistamine.
Text: Aerius contains desloratadine which is an antihistamine.

Element: How Aerius works
Text: How Aerius works

Element: Aerius is an antiallergy medicine that does not make you drowsy. It helps control your allergic reaction and its symptoms.
Text: Aerius is an antiallergy medicine that does not make you drowsy. It helps control your allergic reaction and its symptoms.

Element: When Aerius should be used
Text: When Aerius should be used

Element: Aerius relieves symptoms associated with allergic rhinitis (inflammation of the nasal passages caused by an allergy, for example, hay fever or allergy to dust mites) in adults and adolescents 12 years of age and older. These symptoms include sneezing, runny or itchy nose, itchy palate, and itchy, red or watery eyes.
Text: Aerius relieves symptoms associated with allergic rhinitis (inflammation of the nasal passages caused by an allergy, for example, hay fever or allergy to dust mites) in adults and adolescents 12 years of age and older. These symptoms include sneezing, runny or itchy nose, itchy palate, and itchy, red or watery eyes.

Element: Aerius is also used to relieve the symptoms associated with urticaria (a skin condition caused by an allergy). These symptoms include itching and hives.
Text: Aerius is also used to relieve the symptoms associated with urticaria (a skin condition caused by an allergy). These symptoms include itching and hives.

Element: Relief of these symptoms lasts a full day and helps you to resume your normal daily activities and sleep.
Text: Relief of these symptoms lasts a full day and helps you to resume your normal daily activities and sleep.

Element: 2. What you need to know before you take Aerius
Text: 2.       What you need to know before you take Aerius

Element: Do not take Aerius
Text: Do not take Aerius

Element: - if you are allergic to desloratadine, or any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6) or to loratadine.
Text: -        if you are allergic to desloratadine, or any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6) or to loratadine.

Element: Warnings and precautions
Text: Warnings and precautions

Element: Talk to your doctor, pharmacist or nurse before taking Aerius:
Text: Talk to your doctor, pharmacist or nurse before taking Aerius:

Element: - if you have poor kidney function.
Text: -                 if you have poor kidney function.

Element: - if you have medical or familial history of seizures.
Text: -                 if you have medical or familial history of seizures.

Element: Use in children and adolescents
Text: Use in children and adolescents

Element: Do not give this medicine to children less than 12 years of age.
Text: Do not give this medicine to children less than 12 years of age.

Element: Other medicines and Aerius
Text: Other medicines and Aerius

Element: There are no known interactions of Aerius with other medicines.
Text: There are no known interactions of Aerius with other medicines.

Element: Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are taking, have recently taken or might take any other medicines.
Text: Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are taking, have recently taken or might take any other medicines.

Element: Aerius with food, drink and alcohol
Text: Aerius with food, drink and alcohol

Element: Aerius may be taken with or without a meal.
Text: Aerius may be taken with or without a meal.

Element: Use caution when taking Aerius with alcohol.
Text: Use caution when taking Aerius with alcohol.

Element: Pregnancy, breast-feeding and fertility
Text: Pregnancy, breast-feeding and fertility

Element: If you are pregnant or breast-feeding, think you may be pregnant or are planning to have a baby, ask your doctor or pharmacist for advice before taking this medicine.
Text: If you are pregnant or breast-feeding, think you may be pregnant or are planning to have a baby, ask your doctor or pharmacist for advice before taking this medicine.

Element: Taking Aerius is not recommended if you are pregnant or nursing a baby.
Text: Taking Aerius is not recommended if you are pregnant or nursing a baby.

Element: Fertility
Text: Fertility

Element: There is no data available on male/female fertility.
Text: There is no data available on male/female fertility.

Element: Driving and using machines
Text: Driving and using machines

Element: At the recommended dose, this medicine is not expected to affect your ability to drive or use machines. Although most people do not experience drowsiness, it is recommended not to engage in activities requiring mental alertness, such as driving a car or operating machinery until you have established your own response to the medicinal product.
Text: At the recommended dose, this medicine is not expected to affect your ability to drive or use machines. Although most people do not experience drowsiness, it is recommended not to engage in activities requiring mental alertness, such as driving a car or operating machinery until you have established your own response to the medicinal product.

Element: Aerius contains lactose
Text: Aerius contains lactose

Element: Aerius tablets contain lactose. If you have been told by your doctor that you have an intolerance to some sugars, contact your doctor before taking this medicinal product.
Text: Aerius tablets contain lactose. If you have been told by your doctor that you have an intolerance to some sugars, contact your doctor before taking this medicinal product.

Element: 3. How to take Aerius
Text: 3.       How to take Aerius

Element: Always take this medicine exactly as your doctor or pharmacist has told you. Check with your doctor or pharmacist if you are not sure.
Text: Always take this medicine exactly as your doctor or pharmacist has told you. Check with your doctor or pharmacist if you are not sure.

Element: Adults and adolescents 12 years of age and over
Text: Adults and adolescents 12 years of age and over

Element: The recommended dose is one tablet once a day with water, with or without food.
Text: The recommended dose is one tablet once a day with water, with or without food.

Element: This medicine is for oral use.
Text: This medicine is for oral use.

Element: Swallow the tablet whole.
Text: Swallow the tablet whole.

Element: Regarding the duration of treatment, your physician will determine the type of allergic rhinitis you are suffering from and will determine for how long you should take Aerius.
Text: Regarding the duration of treatment, your physician will determine the type of allergic rhinitis you are suffering from and will determine for how long you should take Aerius.

Element: If your allergic rhinitis is intermittent (presence of symptoms for less than 4 days per week or for less than 4 weeks), your physician will recommend you a treatment schedule that will depend on the evaluation of the history of your disease.
Text: If your allergic rhinitis is intermittent (presence of symptoms for less than 4 days per week or for less than 4 weeks), your physician will recommend you a treatment schedule that will depend on the evaluation of the history of your disease.

Element: If your allergic rhinitis is persistent (presence of symptoms for 4 days or more per week and for more than 4 weeks), your physician may recommend you a longer term treatment.
Text: If your allergic rhinitis is persistent (presence of symptoms for 4 days or more per week and for more than 4 weeks), your physician may recommend you a longer term treatment.

Element: For urticaria, the duration of treatment may be variable from patient to patient and therefore you should follow the instructions of your physician.
Text: For urticaria, the duration of treatment may be variable from patient to patient and therefore you should follow the instructions of your physician.

Element: If you take more Aerius than you should
Text: If you take more Aerius than you should

Element: Take Aerius only as it is prescribed for you. No serious problems are expected with accidental overdose. However, if you take more Aerius than you were told to, tell your doctor, pharmacist or nurse immediately.
Text: Take Aerius only as it is prescribed for you. No serious problems are expected with accidental overdose. However, if you take more Aerius than you were told to, tell your doctor, pharmacist or nurse immediately.

Element: If you forget to take Aerius
Text: If you forget to take Aerius

Element: If you forget to take your dose on time, take it as soon as possible and then go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for a forgotten dose.
Text: If you forget to take your dose on time, take it as soon as possible and then go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for a forgotten dose.

Element: If you stop taking Aerius
Text: If you stop taking Aerius

Element: If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your doctor, pharmacist or nurse.
Text: If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your doctor, pharmacist or nurse.

Element: 4. Possible side effects
Text: 4.       Possible side effects

Element: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects, although not everybody gets them.
Text: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects, although not everybody gets them.

Element: During the marketing of Aerius, cases of severe allergic reactions (difficulty in breathing, wheezing, itching, hives and swelling) have been reported very rarely. If you notice any of these serious side effects, stop taking the medicine and seek urgent medical advice straight away.
Text: During the marketing of Aerius, cases of severe allergic reactions (difficulty in breathing, wheezing, itching, hives and swelling) have been reported very rarely. If you notice any of these serious side effects, stop taking the medicine and seek urgent medical advice straight away.

Element: In clinical studies in adults, side effects were about the same as with a dummy tablet. However, fatigue, dry mouth and headache were reported more often than with a dummy tablet. In adolescents, headache was the most commonly reported side effect.
Text: In clinical studies in adults, side effects were about the same as with a dummy tablet. However, fatigue, dry mouth and headache were reported more often than with a dummy tablet. In adolescents, headache was the most commonly reported side effect.

Element: In clinical studies with Aerius, the following side effects were reported as:
Text: In clinical studies with Aerius, the following side effects were reported as:

Element: Common: the following may affect up to 1 in 10 people
Text: Common: the following may affect up to 1 in 10 people

Element: ● fatigue
Text: ● fatigue

Element: ● dry mouth
Text: ● dry mouth

Element: ● headache
Text: ● headache

Element: Reporting of side effects
Text: Reporting of side effects

Element: If you get any side effects, talk to your doctor, pharmacist or nurse. This includes any possible side effects not listed in this leaflet. You can also report side effects directly via the national reporting system listed in Appendix V. By reporting side effects you can help provide more information on the safety of this medicine.
Text: If you get any side effects, talk to your doctor, pharmacist or nurse. This includes any possible side effects not listed in this leaflet. You can also report side effects directly via the national reporting system listed in Appendix V. By reporting side effects you can help provide more information on the safety of this medicine.

Element: 5. How to store Aerius
Text: 5.       How to store Aerius

Element: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.
Text: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.

Element: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the carton and blister after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.
Text: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the carton and blister after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.

Element: Do not store above 30°C. Store in the original package.
Text: Do not store above 30°C. Store in the original package.

Element: Do not use this medicine if you notice any change in the appearance of the tablets.
Text: Do not use this medicine if you notice any change in the appearance of the tablets.

Element: Do not throw away any medicines via wastewater or household waste. Ask your pharmacist how to throw away medicines you no longer use. These measures will help to protect the environment.
Text: Do not throw away any medicines via wastewater or household waste. Ask your pharmacist how to throw away medicines you no longer use. These measures will help to protect the environment.

Element: - The active substance is desloratadine 5 mg
Text: -                 The active substance is desloratadine 5 mg

Element: - The other ingredients of the tablet are calcium hydrogen phosphate dihydrate, microcrystalline cellulose, maize starch, talc. Tablet coating contains film coat (containing lactose monohydrate, hypromellose, titanium dioxide, macrogol 400, indigotin (E132)), clear coat (containing hypromellose, macrogol 400), carnauba wax, white wax.
Text: -                 The other ingredients of the tablet are calcium hydrogen phosphate dihydrate, microcrystalline cellulose, maize starch, talc. Tablet coating contains film coat (containing lactose monohydrate, hypromellose, titanium dioxide, macrogol 400, indigotin (E132)), clear coat (containing hypromellose, macrogol 400), carnauba wax, white wax.

Text: What Aerius looks like and contents of the pack

Text: Aerius 5 mg film-coated tablets are packed in blisters in packs of 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 10, 14, 15, 20, 21, 30, 50, 90 or 100 tablets.

Element: 1. What Aerius orodispersible tablet is and what it is used for
Text: 1.       What Aerius orodispersible tablet is and what it is used for

Element: What Aerius is
Text: What Aerius is

Element: Aerius contains desloratadine which is an antihistamine.
Text: Aerius contains desloratadine which is an antihistamine.

Element: How Aerius works
Text: How Aerius works

Element: Aerius orodispersible tablet is an antiallergy medicine that does not make you drowsy. It helps control your allergic reaction and its symptoms.
Text: Aerius orodispersible tablet is an antiallergy medicine that does not make you drowsy. It helps control your allergic reaction and its symptoms.

Element: When Aerius should be used
Text: When Aerius should be used

Element: Aerius orodispersible tablet relieves symptoms associated with allergic rhinitis (inflammation of the nasal passages caused by an allergy, for example, hay fever or allergy to dust mites) in adults, adolescents and children 6 years of age and older. These symptoms include sneezing, runny or itchy nose, itchy palate, and itchy, red or watery eyes.
Text: Aerius orodispersible tablet relieves symptoms associated with allergic rhinitis (inflammation of the nasal passages caused by an allergy, for example, hay fever or allergy to dust mites) in adults, adolescents and children 6 years of age and older. These symptoms include sneezing, runny or itchy nose, itchy palate, and itchy, red or watery eyes.

Element: Aerius orodispersible tablet is also used to relieve the symptoms associated with urticaria (a skin condition caused by an allergy). These symptoms include itching and hives.
Text: Aerius orodispersible tablet is also used to relieve the symptoms associated with urticaria (a skin condition caused by an allergy). These symptoms include itching and hives.

Element: Relief of these symptoms lasts a full day and helps you to resume your normal daily activities and sleep.
Text: Relief of these symptoms lasts a full day and helps you to resume your normal daily activities and sleep.

Element: 2. What you need to know before you take Aerius orodispersible tablet
Text: 2.       What you need to know before you take Aerius orodispersible tablet

Element: Do not take Aerius orodispersible tablet
Text: Do not take Aerius orodispersible tablet

Element: - if you are allergic to desloratadine, or any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6) or to loratadine.
Text: -        if you are allergic to desloratadine, or any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6) or to loratadine.

Element: Warnings and precautions
Text: Warnings and precautions

Element: Talk to your doctor, pharmacist or nurse before taking Aerius:
Text: Talk to your doctor, pharmacist or nurse before taking Aerius:

Element: - if you have poor kidney function.
Text: -                 if you have poor kidney function.

Element: - if you have medical or familial history of seizures.
Text: -                 if you have medical or familial history of seizures.

Element: Use in children and adolescents
Text: Use in children and adolescents

Element: Do not give this medicine to children less than 6 years of age.
Text: Do not give this medicine to children less than 6 years of age.

Element: Other medicines and Aerius
Text: Other medicines and Aerius

Element: There are no known interactions of Aerius with other medicines.
Text: There are no known interactions of Aerius with other medicines.

Element: Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are taking, have recently taken or might take any other medicines.
Text: Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are taking, have recently taken or might take any other medicines.

Element: Aerius orodispersible tablet with food, drink and alcohol
Text: Aerius orodispersible tablet with food, drink and alcohol

Element: Aerius orodispersible tablet does not need to be taken with water or liquid. Additionally, Aerius orodispersible tablet may be taken with or without a meal. Use caution when taking Aerius with alcohol.
Text: Aerius orodispersible tablet does not need to be taken with water or liquid. Additionally, Aerius orodispersible tablet may be taken with or without a meal. Use caution when taking Aerius with alcohol.

Element: Pregnancy, breast-feeding and fertility
Text: Pregnancy, breast-feeding and fertility

Element: If you are pregnant or breast-feeding, think you may be pregnant or are planning to have a baby, ask your doctor or pharmacist for advice before taking this medicine.
Text: If you are pregnant or breast-feeding, think you may be pregnant or are planning to have a baby, ask your doctor or pharmacist for advice before taking this medicine.

Element: Taking Aerius is not recommended if you are pregnant or nursing a baby.
Text: Taking Aerius is not recommended if you are pregnant or nursing a baby.

Element: Fertility
Text: Fertility

Element: There is no data available on male/female fertility.
Text: There is no data available on male/female fertility.

Element: Driving and using machines
Text: Driving and using machines

Element: At the recommended dose, this medicine is not expected to affect your ability to drive or use machines. Although most people do not experience drowsiness, it is recommended not to engage in activities requiring mental alertness, such as driving a car or operating machinery until you have established your own response to the medicinal product.
Text: At the recommended dose, this medicine is not expected to affect your ability to drive or use machines. Although most people do not experience drowsiness, it is recommended not to engage in activities requiring mental alertness, such as driving a car or operating machinery until you have established your own response to the medicinal product.

Element: Aerius orodispersible tablet contains aspartame
Text: Aerius orodispersible tablet contains aspartame

Element: This product contains aspartame. Aspartame is a source of phenylalanine, which may be harmful for people with phenylketonuria.
Text: This product contains aspartame. Aspartame is a source of phenylalanine, which may be harmful for people with phenylketonuria.

Element: 3. How to take Aerius orodispersible tablet
Text: 3.       How to take Aerius orodispersible tablet

Element: Always take this medicine exactly as your doctor or pharmacist has told you. Check with your doctor or pharmacist if you are not sure.
Text: Always take this medicine exactly as your doctor or pharmacist has told you. Check with your doctor or pharmacist if you are not sure.

Element: Adults and adolescents 12 years of age and over
Text: Adults and adolescents 12 years of age and over

Element: The recommended dose is two tablets once a day with or without food.
Text: The recommended dose is two tablets once a day with or without food.

Element: This medicine is for oral use.
Text: This medicine is for oral use.

Element: Before using, carefully peel open the blister and remove the dose of orodispersible tablet without crushing it. Place it in your mouth and it will disperse immediately. Water or other liquid is not needed to swallow the dose. Take the dose immediately after removal from the blister.
Text: Before using, carefully peel open the blister and remove the dose of orodispersible tablet without crushing it. Place it in your mouth and it will disperse immediately. Water or other liquid is not needed to swallow the dose. Take the dose immediately after removal from the blister.

Element: Children from 6 to 11 years of age
Text: Children from 6 to 11 years of age

Element: The recommended dose is one tablet once a day with or without food.
Text: The recommended dose is one tablet once a day with or without food.

Element: Regarding the duration of treatment, your physician will determine the type of allergic rhinitis you are suffering from and will determine for how long you should take Aerius orodispersible tablets.
Text: Regarding the duration of treatment, your physician will determine the type of allergic rhinitis you are suffering from and will determine for how long you should take Aerius orodispersible tablets.

Element: If your allergic rhinitis is intermittent (presence of symptoms for less than 4 days per week or for less than 4 weeks), your physician will recommend you a treatment schedule that will depend on the evaluation of the history of your disease.
Text: If your allergic rhinitis is intermittent (presence of symptoms for less than 4 days per week or for less than 4 weeks), your physician will recommend you a treatment schedule that will depend on the evaluation of the history of your disease.

Element: If your allergic rhinitis is persistent (presence of symptoms for 4 days or more per week and for more than 4 weeks), your physician may recommend you a longer term treatment.
Text: If your allergic rhinitis is persistent (presence of symptoms for 4 days or more per week and for more than 4 weeks), your physician may recommend you a longer term treatment.

Element: For urticaria, the duration of treatment may be variable from patient to patient and therefore you should follow the instructions of your physician.
Text: For urticaria, the duration of treatment may be variable from patient to patient and therefore you should follow the instructions of your physician.

Element: If you take more Aerius orodispersible tablet than you should
Text: If you take more Aerius orodispersible tablet than you should

Element: Take Aerius orodispersible tablet only as prescribed for you. No serious problems are expected with accidental overdose. However, if you take more Aerius orodispersible tablet than you were told to, tell your doctor, pharmacist or nurse immediately.
Text: Take Aerius orodispersible tablet only as prescribed for you. No serious problems are expected with accidental overdose. However, if you take more Aerius orodispersible tablet than you were told to, tell your doctor, pharmacist or nurse immediately.

Element: If you forget to take Aerius orodispersible tablet
Text: If you forget to take Aerius orodispersible tablet

Element: If you forget to take your dose on time, take it as soon as possible and then go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for forgotten individual doses.
Text: If you forget to take your dose on time, take it as soon as possible and then go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for forgotten individual doses.

Element: If you stop taking Aerius orodispersible tablet
Text: If you stop taking Aerius orodispersible tablet

Element: If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your doctor, pharmacist or nurse.
Text: If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your doctor, pharmacist or nurse.

Element: 4. Possible side effects
Text: 4.       Possible side effects

Element: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects although not everybody gets them.
Text: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects although not everybody gets them.

Element: During the marketing of Aerius, cases of severe allergic reactions (difficulty in breathing, wheezing, itching, hives and swelling) have been reported very rarely. If you notice any of these serious side effects, stop taking the medicine and seek urgent medical advice straight away.
Text: During the marketing of Aerius, cases of severe allergic reactions (difficulty in breathing, wheezing, itching, hives and swelling) have been reported very rarely. If you notice any of these serious side effects, stop taking the medicine and seek urgent medical advice straight away.

Element: In clinical studies in adults, side effects were about the same as with a dummy tablet. However, fatigue, dry mouth and headache were reported more often than with a dummy tablet. In adolescents, headache was the most commonly reported side effect.
Text: In clinical studies in adults, side effects were about the same as with a dummy tablet. However, fatigue, dry mouth and headache were reported more often than with a dummy tablet. In adolescents, headache was the most commonly reported side effect.

Element: In clinical studies with Aerius, the following side effects were reported as:
Text: In clinical studies with Aerius, the following side effects were reported as:

Element: Common: the following may affect up to 1 in 10 people
Text: Common: the following may affect up to 1 in 10 people

Element: ● fatigue
Text: ● fatigue

Element: ● dry mouth
Text: ● dry mouth

Element: ● headache
Text: ● headache

Text: Adults

Text: During the marketing of Aerius, the following side effects were reported as:

Element: Very rare: the following may affect up to 1 in 10,000 people
Text: Very rare: the following may affect up to 1 in 10,000 people

Text: ● severe allergic reactions          ● rash                            ● pounding or irregular heartbeat

Text: ● fast heartbeat                                  ● stomach ache               ● feeling sick (nausea)

Text: ● vomiting                                        ● upset stomach              ● diarrhoea

Text: ● dizziness                                        ● drowsiness          ● inability to sleep

Element: ● muscle pain ● hallucinations ● seizures
Text: ● muscle pain                                    ● hallucinations              ● seizures

Text: ● restlessness with increased               ● liver inflammation        ● abnormal liver function tests

Text: Not known: frequency cannot be estimated from the available data

Text: ● unusual weakness                           ● yellowing of the skin and/or eyes

Text: ● increased sensitivity of the skin to the sun, even in case of hazy sun, and to UV light, for instance to UV lights of a solarium

Element: Reporting of side effects
Text: Reporting of side effects

Element: If you get any side effects, talk to your doctor, pharmacist or nurse. This includes any possible side effects not listed in this leaflet. You can also report side effects directly via the national reporting system listed in Appendix V. By reporting side effects you can help provide more information on the safety of this medicine.
Text: If you get any side effects, talk to your doctor, pharmacist or nurse. This includes any possible side effects not listed in this leaflet. You can also report side effects directly via the national reporting system listed in Appendix V. By reporting side effects you can help provide more information on the safety of this medicine.

Element: 5. How to store Aerius orodispersible tablet
Text: 5.       How to store Aerius orodispersible tablet

Element: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.
Text: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.

Element: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the carton and blister after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.
Text: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the carton and blister after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.

Element: Store in the original package.
Text: Store in the original package.

Element: Do not use this medicine if you notice any change in the appearance of Aerius orodispersible tablet.
Text: Do not use this medicine if you notice any change in the appearance of Aerius orodispersible tablet.

Element: Do not throw away any medicines via wastewater or household waste. Ask your pharmacist how to throw away medicines you no longer use. These measures will help to protect the environment.
Text: Do not throw away any medicines via wastewater or household waste. Ask your pharmacist how to throw away medicines you no longer use. These measures will help to protect the environment.

Element: What Aerius orodispersible tablet contains
Text: What Aerius orodispersible tablet contains

Element: - The active substance is desloratadine 2.5 mg
Text: -                 The active substance is desloratadine 2.5 mg

Element: - The other ingredients are microcrystalline cellulose, pregelatinized starch, sodium starch glycolate, magnesium stearate, butylated methacrylate copolymer, crospovidone, sodium hydrogen carbonate, citric acid, colloidal silicon dioxide, ferric oxide, mannitol, aspartame (E951) and flavour Tutti-Frutti.
Text: -        The other ingredients are microcrystalline cellulose, pregelatinized starch, sodium starch glycolate, magnesium stearate, butylated methacrylate copolymer, crospovidone, sodium hydrogen carbonate, citric acid, colloidal silicon dioxide, ferric oxide, mannitol, aspartame (E951) and flavour Tutti-Frutti.

Element: What Aerius orodispersible tablet looks like and contents of the pack
Text: What Aerius orodispersible tablet looks like and contents of the pack

Element: Aerius 2.5 mg orodispersible tablet is light red, speckled, and round with “K” branded on one side. Aerius orodispersible tablet is packed in unit dose blisters in packs of 5, 6, 10, 12, 15, 18, 20, 30, 50, 60, 90 and 100 doses of orodispersible tablet. Not all pack sizes may be marketed.
Text: Aerius 2.5 mg orodispersible tablet is light red, speckled, and round with “K” branded on one side. Aerius orodispersible tablet is packed in unit dose blisters in packs of 5, 6, 10, 12, 15, 18, 20, 30, 50, 60, 90 and 100 doses of orodispersible tablet. Not all pack sizes may be marketed.

Element: 1. What Aerius orodispersible tablet is and what it is used for
Text: 1.       What Aerius orodispersible tablet is and what it is used for

Element: What Aerius is
Text: What Aerius is

Element: Aerius contains desloratadine which is an antihistamine.
Text: Aerius contains desloratadine which is an antihistamine.

Element: How Aerius works
Text: How Aerius works

Element: Aerius orodispersible tablet is an antiallergy medicine that does not make you drowsy. It helps control your allergic reaction and its symptoms.
Text: Aerius orodispersible tablet is an antiallergy medicine that does not make you drowsy. It helps control your allergic reaction and its symptoms.

Element: When Aerius should be used
Text: When Aerius should be used

Element: Aerius orodispersible tablet relieves symptoms associated with allergic rhinitis (inflammation of the nasal passages caused by an allergy, for example, hay fever or allergy to dust mites) in adults and adolescents 12 years of age and older. These symptoms include sneezing, runny or itchy nose, itchy palate, and itchy, red or watery eyes.
Text: Aerius orodispersible tablet relieves symptoms associated with allergic rhinitis (inflammation of the nasal passages caused by an allergy, for example, hay fever or allergy to dust mites) in adults and adolescents 12 years of age and older. These symptoms include sneezing, runny or itchy nose, itchy palate, and itchy, red or watery eyes.

Element: Aerius orodispersible tablet is also used to relieve the symptoms associated with urticaria (a skin condition caused by an allergy). These symptoms include itching and hives.
Text: Aerius orodispersible tablet is also used to relieve the symptoms associated with urticaria (a skin condition caused by an allergy). These symptoms include itching and hives.

Element: Relief of these symptoms lasts a full day and helps you to resume your normal daily activities and sleep.
Text: Relief of these symptoms lasts a full day and helps you to resume your normal daily activities and sleep.

Element: 2. What you need to know before you take Aerius orodispersible tablet
Text: 2.       What you need to know before you take Aerius orodispersible tablet

Element: Do not take Aerius orodispersible tablet
Text: Do not take Aerius orodispersible tablet

Element: - if you are allergic to desloratadine, or any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6) or to loratadine.
Text: -        if you are allergic to desloratadine, or any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6) or to loratadine.

Element: Warnings and precautions
Text: Warnings and precautions

Element: Talk to your doctor, pharmacist or nurse before taking Aerius:
Text: Talk to your doctor, pharmacist or nurse before taking Aerius:

Element: - if you have poor kidney function.
Text: -                 if you have poor kidney function.

Element: - if you have medical or familial history of seizures.
Text: -                 if you have medical or familial history of seizures.

Element: Use in children and adolescents
Text: Use in children and adolescents

Element: Do not give this medicine to children less than 12 years of age.
Text: Do not give this medicine to children less than 12 years of age.

Element: Other medicines and Aerius
Text: Other medicines and Aerius

Element: There are no known interactions of Aerius with other medicines.
Text: There are no known interactions of Aerius with other medicines.

Element: Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are taking, have recently taken or might take any other medicines.
Text: Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are taking, have recently taken or might take any other medicines.

Element: Aerius orodispersible tablet with food, drink and alcohol
Text: Aerius orodispersible tablet with food, drink and alcohol

Element: Aerius orodispersible tablet does not need to be taken with water or liquid. Additionally, Aerius orodispersible tablet may be taken with or without a meal. Use caution when taking Aerius with alcohol.
Text: Aerius orodispersible tablet does not need to be taken with water or liquid. Additionally, Aerius orodispersible tablet may be taken with or without a meal. Use caution when taking Aerius with alcohol.

Element: Pregnancy, breast-feeding and fertility
Text: Pregnancy, breast-feeding and fertility

Element: If you are pregnant or breast-feeding, think you may be pregnant or are planning to have a baby, ask your doctor or pharmacist for advice before taking this medicine.
Text: If you are pregnant or breast-feeding, think you may be pregnant or are planning to have a baby, ask your doctor or pharmacist for advice before taking this medicine.

Element: Taking Aerius is not recommended if you are pregnant or nursing a baby.
Text: Taking Aerius is not recommended if you are pregnant or nursing a baby.

Element: Fertility
Text: Fertility

Element: There is no data available on male/female fertility.
Text: There is no data available on male/female fertility.

Element: Driving and using machines
Text: Driving and using machines

Element: At the recommended dose, this medicine is not expected to affect your ability to drive or use machines. Although most people do not experience drowsiness, it is recommended not to engage in activities requiring mental alertness, such as driving a car or operating machinery until you have established your own response to the medicinal product.
Text: At the recommended dose, this medicine is not expected to affect your ability to drive or use machines. Although most people do not experience drowsiness, it is recommended not to engage in activities requiring mental alertness, such as driving a car or operating machinery until you have established your own response to the medicinal product.

Element: Aerius orodispersible tablet contains aspartame
Text: Aerius orodispersible tablet contains aspartame

Element: This product contains aspartame. Aspartame is a source of phenylalanine, which may be harmful for people with phenylketonuria.
Text: This product contains aspartame. Aspartame is a source of phenylalanine, which may be harmful for people with phenylketonuria.

Element: 3. How to take Aerius orodispersible tablet
Text: 3.       How to take Aerius orodispersible tablet

Element: Always take this medicine exactly as your doctor or pharmacist has told you. Check with your doctor or pharmacist if you are not sure.
Text: Always take this medicine exactly as your doctor or pharmacist has told you. Check with your doctor or pharmacist if you are not sure.

Element: Adults and adolescents 12 years of age and over
Text: Adults and adolescents 12 years of age and over

Element: The recommended dose is one tablet once a day with or without food.
Text: The recommended dose is one tablet once a day with or without food.

Element: This medicine is for oral use.
Text: This medicine is for oral use.

Element: Before using, carefully peel open the blister and remove the dose of orodispersible tablet without crushing it. Place it in your mouth and it will disperse immediately. Water or other liquid is not needed to swallow the dose. Take the dose immediately after removal from the blister.
Text: Before using, carefully peel open the blister and remove the dose of orodispersible tablet without crushing it. Place it in your mouth and it will disperse immediately. Water or other liquid is not needed to swallow the dose. Take the dose immediately after removal from the blister.

Element: Regarding the duration of treatment, your physician will determine the type of allergic rhinitis you are suffering from and will determine for how long you should take Aerius orodispersible tablets.
Text: Regarding the duration of treatment, your physician will determine the type of allergic rhinitis you are suffering from and will determine for how long you should take Aerius orodispersible tablets.

Element: If your allergic rhinitis is intermittent (presence of symptoms for less than 4 days per week or for less than 4 weeks), your physician will recommend you a treatment schedule that will depend on the evaluation of the history of your disease.
Text: If your allergic rhinitis is intermittent (presence of symptoms for less than 4 days per week or for less than 4 weeks), your physician will recommend you a treatment schedule that will depend on the evaluation of the history of your disease.

Element: If your allergic rhinitis is persistent (presence of symptoms for 4 days or more per week and for more than 4 weeks), your physician may recommend you a longer term treatment.
Text: If your allergic rhinitis is persistent (presence of symptoms for 4 days or more per week and for more than 4 weeks), your physician may recommend you a longer term treatment.

Element: For urticaria, the duration of treatment may be variable from patient to patient and therefore you should follow the instructions of your physician.
Text: For urticaria, the duration of treatment may be variable from patient to patient and therefore you should follow the instructions of your physician.

Element: If you take more Aerius orodispersible tablet than you should
Text: If you take more Aerius orodispersible tablet than you should

Element: Take Aerius orodispersible tablet only as prescribed for you. No serious problems are expected with accidental overdose. However, if you take more Aerius orodispersible tablet than you were told to, tell your doctor, pharmacist or nurse immediately.
Text: Take Aerius orodispersible tablet only as prescribed for you. No serious problems are expected with accidental overdose. However, if you take more Aerius orodispersible tablet than you were told to, tell your doctor, pharmacist or nurse immediately.

Element: If you forget to take Aerius orodispersible tablet
Text: If you forget to take Aerius orodispersible tablet

Element: If you forget to take your dose on time, take it as soon as possible and then go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for forgotten individual doses.
Text: If you forget to take your dose on time, take it as soon as possible and then go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for forgotten individual doses.

Element: If you stop taking Aerius orodispersible tablet
Text: If you stop taking Aerius orodispersible tablet

Element: If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your doctor, pharmacist or nurse.
Text: If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your doctor, pharmacist or nurse.

Element: 4. Possible side effects
Text: 4.       Possible side effects

Element: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects although not everybody gets them.
Text: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects although not everybody gets them.

Element: During the marketing of Aerius, cases of severe allergic reactions (difficulty in breathing, wheezing, itching, hives and swelling) have been reported very rarely. If you notice any of these serious side effects, stop taking the medicine and seek urgent medical advice straight away.
Text: During the marketing of Aerius, cases of severe allergic reactions (difficulty in breathing, wheezing, itching, hives and swelling) have been reported very rarely. If you notice any of these serious side effects, stop taking the medicine and seek urgent medical advice straight away.

Element: In clinical studies in adults, side effects were about the same as with a dummy tablet. However, fatigue, dry mouth and headache were reported more often than with a dummy tablet. In adolescents, headache was the most commonly reported side effect.
Text: In clinical studies in adults, side effects were about the same as with a dummy tablet. However, fatigue, dry mouth and headache were reported more often than with a dummy tablet. In adolescents, headache was the most commonly reported side effect.

Element: In clinical studies with Aerius, the following side effects were reported as:
Text: In clinical studies with Aerius, the following side effects were reported as:

Text: Common: the following may affect up to 1 in 10 people

Element: ● fatigue
Text: ● fatigue

Element: ● dry mouth
Text: ● dry mouth

Element: ● headache
Text: ● headache

Text: During the marketing of Aerius, the following side effects were reported as:

You can also report side effects directly via the national reporting system listed in Appendix V. By reporting side effects you can help provide more information on the safety of this medicine.

Element: 5. How to store Aerius orodispersible tablet
Text: 5.       How to store Aerius orodispersible tablet

Element: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.
Text: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.

Element: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the carton and blister after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.
Text: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the carton and blister after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.

Element: Store in the original package.
Text: Store in the original package.

Element: Do not use this medicine if you notice any change in the appearance of Aerius orodispersible tablet.
Text: Do not use this medicine if you notice any change in the appearance of Aerius orodispersible tablet.

Element: Do not throw away any medicines via wastewater or household waste. Ask your pharmacist how to throw away medicines you no longer use. These measures will help to protect the environment.
Text: Do not throw away any medicines via wastewater or household waste. Ask your pharmacist how to throw away medicines you no longer use. These measures will help to protect the environment.

Text: What Aerius orodispersible tablet looks like and contents of the pack

Text: Aerius 5 mg orodispersible tablet is light red, speckled, and round with “A” branded on one side. Aerius orodispersible tablet is packed in unit dose blisters in packs of 5, 6, 10, 12, 15, 18, 20, 30, 50, 60, 90 and 100 doses of orodispersible tablet.

Element: 1. What Aerius oral solution is and what it is used for
Text: 1.       What Aerius oral solution is and what it is used for

Element: What Aerius is
Text: What Aerius is

Element: Aerius contains desloratadine which is an antihistamine.
Text: Aerius contains desloratadine which is an antihistamine.

Element: How Aerius works
Text: How Aerius works

Element: Aerius oral solution is an antiallergy medicine that does not make you drowsy. It helps control your allergic reaction and its symptoms.
Text: Aerius oral solution is an antiallergy medicine that does not make you drowsy. It helps control your allergic reaction and its symptoms.

Element: When Aerius should be used
Text: When Aerius should be used

Element: Aerius oral solution relieves symptoms associated with allergic rhinitis (inflammation of the nasal passages caused by an allergy, for example, hay fever or allergy to dust mites) in adults, adolescents and children 1 year of age and older. These symptoms include sneezing, runny or itchy nose, itchy palate, and itchy, red or watery eyes.
Text: Aerius oral solution relieves symptoms associated with allergic rhinitis (inflammation of the nasal passages caused by an allergy, for example, hay fever or allergy to dust mites) in adults, adolescents and children 1 year of age and older. These symptoms include sneezing, runny or itchy nose, itchy palate, and itchy, red or watery eyes.

Element: Aerius oral solution is also used to relieve the symptoms associated with urticaria (a skin condition caused by an allergy). These symptoms include itching and hives.
Text: Aerius oral solution is also used to relieve the symptoms associated with urticaria (a skin condition caused by an allergy). These symptoms include itching and hives.

Element: Relief of these symptoms lasts a full day and helps you to resume your normal daily activities and sleep.
Text: Relief of these symptoms lasts a full day and helps you to resume your normal daily activities and sleep.

Element: 2. What you need to know before you take Aerius oral solution
Text: 2.       What you need to know before you take Aerius oral solution

Element: Do not take Aerius oral solution
Text: Do not take Aerius oral solution

Element: - if you are allergic to desloratadine, or to any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6) or to loratadine.
Text: -        if you are allergic to desloratadine, or to any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6) or to loratadine.

Element: Warnings and precautions
Text: Warnings and precautions

Element: Talk to your doctor, pharmacist or nurse before taking Aerius:
Text: Talk to your doctor, pharmacist or nurse before taking Aerius:

Element: - if you have poor kidney function.
Text: -                 if you have poor kidney function.

Element: - if you have medical or familial history of seizures.
Text: -                 if you have medical or familial history of seizures.

Element: Use in children and adolescents
Text: Use in children and adolescents

Element: Do not give this medicine to children less than 1 year of age.
Text: Do not give this medicine to children less than 1 year of age.

Element: Other medicines and Aerius
Text: Other medicines and Aerius

Element: There are no known interactions of Aerius with other medicines.
Text: There are no known interactions of Aerius with other medicines.

Element: Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are taking, have recently taken or might take any other medicines.
Text: Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are taking, have recently taken or might take any other medicines.

Element: Aerius oral solution with food, drink and alcohol
Text: Aerius oral solution with food, drink and alcohol

Element: Aerius may be taken with or without a meal.
Text: Aerius may be taken with or without a meal.

Element: Use caution when taking Aerius with alcohol.
Text: Use caution when taking Aerius with alcohol.

Element: Pregnancy, breast-feeding and fertility
Text: Pregnancy, breast-feeding and fertility

Element: If you are pregnant or breast-feeding, think you may be pregnant or are planning to have a baby, ask your doctor or pharmacist for advice before taking this medicine.
Text: If you are pregnant or breast-feeding, think you may be pregnant or are planning to have a baby, ask your doctor or pharmacist for advice before taking this medicine.

Element: Taking Aerius oral solution is not recommended if you are pregnant or nursing a baby.
Text: Taking Aerius oral solution is not recommended if you are pregnant or nursing a baby.

Element: Fertility
Text: Fertility

Element: There is no data available on male/female fertility.
Text: There is no data available on male/female fertility.

Element: Driving and using machines
Text: Driving and using machines

Element: At the recommended dose, this medicine is not expected to affect your ability to drive or use machines. Although most people do not experience drowsiness, it is recommended not to engage in activities requiring mental alertness, such as driving a car or operating machinery until you have established your own response to the medicinal product.
Text: At the recommended dose, this medicine is not expected to affect your ability to drive or use machines. Although most people do not experience drowsiness, it is recommended not to engage in activities requiring mental alertness, such as driving a car or operating machinery until you have established your own response to the medicinal product.

Element: Aerius oral solution contains sorbitol
Text: Aerius oral solution contains sorbitol

Element: Aerius oral solution contains sorbitol. If you have been told by your doctor that you have an intolerance to some sugars, contact your doctor before taking this medicinal product.
Text: Aerius oral solution contains sorbitol. If you have been told by your doctor that you have an intolerance to some sugars, contact your doctor before taking this medicinal product.

Element: 3. How to take Aerius oral solution
Text: 3.       How to take Aerius oral solution

Element: Always take this medicine exactly as your doctor or pharmacist has told you. Check with your doctor or pharmacist if you are not sure.
Text: Always take this medicine exactly as your doctor or pharmacist has told you. Check with your doctor or pharmacist if you are not sure.

Element: Children
Text: Children

Element: Children 1 through 5 years of age:
Text: Children 1 through 5 years of age:

Element: The recommended dose is 2.5 ml (½ of a 5 ml spoonful) of oral solution once a day.
Text: The recommended dose is 2.5 ml (½ of a 5 ml spoonful) of oral solution once a day.

Element: Children 6 through 11 years of age:
Text: Children 6 through 11 years of age:

Element: The recommended dose is 5 ml (one 5 ml spoonful) of oral solution once a day.
Text: The recommended dose is 5 ml (one 5 ml spoonful) of oral solution once a day.

Element: Adults and adolescents 12 years of age and over
Text: Adults and adolescents 12 years of age and over

Element: The recommended dose is 10 ml (two 5 ml spoonfuls) of oral solution once a day.
Text: The recommended dose is 10 ml (two 5 ml spoonfuls) of oral solution once a day.

Element: In case an oral measuring syringe is provided with the bottle of oral solution, you can alternatively use it to take the appropriate amount of oral solution.
Text: In case an oral measuring syringe is provided with the bottle of oral solution, you can alternatively use it to take the appropriate amount of oral solution.

Element: This medicine is for oral use.
Text: This medicine is for oral use.

Element: Swallow the dose of oral solution and then drink some water. You can take this medicine with or without food.
Text: Swallow the dose of oral solution and then drink some water. You can take this medicine with or without food.

Element: Regarding the duration of treatment, your physician will determine the type of allergic rhinitis you are suffering from and will determine for how long you should take Aerius oral solution.
Text: Regarding the duration of treatment, your physician will determine the type of allergic rhinitis you are suffering from and will determine for how long you should take Aerius oral solution.

Element: If your allergic rhinitis is intermittent (presence of symptoms for less than 4 days per week or for less than 4 weeks), your physician will recommend you a treatment schedule that will depend on the evaluation of the history of your disease.
Text: If your allergic rhinitis is intermittent (presence of symptoms for less than 4 days per week or for less than 4 weeks), your physician will recommend you a treatment schedule that will depend on the evaluation of the history of your disease.

Element: If your allergic rhinitis is persistent (presence of symptoms for 4 days or more per week and for more than 4 weeks), your physician may recommend you a longer term treatment.
Text: If your allergic rhinitis is persistent (presence of symptoms for 4 days or more per week and for more than 4 weeks), your physician may recommend you a longer term treatment.

Element: For urticaria, the duration of treatment may be variable from patient to patient and therefore you should follow the instructions of your physician.
Text: For urticaria, the duration of treatment may be variable from patient to patient and therefore you should follow the instructions of your physician.

Element: If you take more Aerius oral solution than you should
Text: If you take more Aerius oral solution than you should

Element: Take Aerius oral solution only as it is prescribed for you. No serious problems are expected with accidental overdose. However, if you take more Aerius oral solution than you were told to, tell your doctor, pharmacist or nurse immediately.
Text: Take Aerius oral solution only as it is prescribed for you. No serious problems are expected with accidental overdose. However, if you take more Aerius oral solution than you were told to, tell your doctor, pharmacist or nurse immediately.

Element: If you forget to take Aerius oral solution
Text: If you forget to take Aerius oral solution

Element: If you forget to take your dose on time, take it as soon as possible and then go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for a forgotten dose.
Text: If you forget to take your dose on time, take it as soon as possible and then go back to your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for a forgotten dose.

Element: If you stop taking Aerius oral solution
Text: If you stop taking Aerius oral solution

Element: If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your doctor, pharmacist or nurse.
Text: If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your doctor, pharmacist or nurse.

Element: 4. Possible side effects
Text: 4.       Possible side effects

Element: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects, although not everybody gets them.
Text: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects, although not everybody gets them.

Element: During the marketing of Aerius, cases of severe allergic reactions (difficulty in breathing, wheezing, itching, hives and swelling) have been reported very rarely. If you notice any of these serious side effects, stop taking the medicine and seek urgent medical advice straight away.
Text: During the marketing of Aerius, cases of severe allergic reactions (difficulty in breathing, wheezing, itching, hives and swelling) have been reported very rarely. If you notice any of these serious side effects, stop taking the medicine and seek urgent medical advice straight away.

Element: In clinical studies in most children and adults, side effects with Aerius were about the same as with a dummy solution or tablet. However, common side effects in children less than 2 years of age were diarrhoea, fever and insomnia while in adults, fatigue, dry mouth and headache were reported more often than with a dummy tablet.
Text: In clinical studies in most children and adults, side effects with Aerius were about the same as with a dummy solution or tablet. However, common side effects in children less than 2 years of age were diarrhoea, fever and insomnia while in adults, fatigue, dry mouth and headache were reported more often than with a dummy tablet.

You can also report side effects directly via the national reporting system listed in Appendix V. By reporting side effects you can help provide more information on the safety of this medicine.

Element: 5. How to store Aerius oral solution
Text: 5.       How to store Aerius oral solution

Element: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.
Text: Keep this medicine out of the sight and reach of children.

Element: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the bottle after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.
Text: Do not use this medicine after the expiry date which is stated on the bottle after EXP. The expiry date refers to the last day of that month.

Element: Do not freeze. Store in the original package.
Text: Do not freeze. Store in the original package.

Element: Do not use this medicine if you notice any change in the appearance of the oral solution.
Text: Do not use this medicine if you notice any change in the appearance of the oral solution.

Element: Do not throw away any medicines via wastewater or household waste. Ask your pharmacist how to throw away medicines you no longer use. These measures will help to protect the environment.
Text: Do not throw away any medicines via wastewater or household waste. Ask your pharmacist how to throw away medicines you no longer use. These measures will help to protect the environment.

Text: What Aerius oral solution looks like and contents of the pack

Element: Aerius oral solution is available in bottles of 30, 50, 60, 100, 120, 150, 225 and 300 ml, with a childproof cap. For all packages except the 150 ml bottle, a measuring spoon is provided, marked for doses of 2.5 ml and 5 ml. For the 150 ml package, a measuring spoon or an oral measuring syringe is provided, marked for doses of 2.5 ml and 5 ml.
